title: Anti-Islam populist Geert Wilders wins Dutch election
description: Wilders' Freedom Party won 35 seats in parliament on Wednesday, a landslide according to the Ipsos exit poll. If confirmed, the populist's victory will be viewed with trepidation in Brussels: his party promised a referendum on Dutch membership of the European Union.

title: 2 dead after vehicle explodes at Rainbow Bridge border crossing in Niagara Falls
description: The vehicle speeding toward a US-Canada bridge from the American side crashed and exploded at a checkpoint on Wednesday. The incident prompted the closing of four border crossings in the area.

title: French MEPs claim victory as European Parliament votes not to ban Camembert box
description: A European proposal on packaging waste management led to a sudden flurry of activity by French MEPs, with lawmakers ranging from liberals to the far-right voting to save the traditional wooden camembert box.

title: From a painting to a viral photo, a fight for Ukraine's history
description: The French photographer Emeric Lhuisse staged a new version of a painting by 19th-century Ukrainian artist Ilya Repin, a famous work that is claimed by both Russia and Ukraine.

title: French senator, suspected of drugging MP, dropped by political allies
description: While in previous cases politicians said the 'presumption of innocence' prevailed, Senator Joël Guerriau was immediately suspended by his own party, Horizons, and then asked to 'step aside' by Sénat President Gérard Larcher.

title: Guns N' Roses frontman Axl Rose accused of sexual assault
description: Rose was accused of sexually assaulting Sheila Kennedy in 1989, 'pursuant to the N.Y. Adult Survivors Act,' a New York law allowing sexual abuse victims to file suits past the statute of limitations, which expires Thursday.

title: 'Moscow's tone is triumphalist, and yet, the war amplifies existing handicaps of Russia's economy'
description: While Vladimir Putin tries to show Russia at its best, the war against Ukraine has ultimately absorbed all the country's resources and lifeblood, writes Le Monde columnist Jean-Michel Bezat.

title: Venezuela accuses Peru of 'kidnapping' its football team
description: Amidst a wild night of violent clashes between Lima police, Venezuelan players and football fans, Caracas has alleged that Lima prevented 'the plane bringing the team back from refueling.'

title: France refuses to pay up for failing to meet renewable energy targets
description: In 2009, the government pledged to achieve a share of 23% renewables (wind, solar, hydro) in its gross final energy consumption by 2020. But it only reached 20.7% in 2022.

title: UK unveils sweeping tax cuts in budget ahead of election
description: British Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt delivered an autumn statement on Wednesday hoping to woo voters ahead of the 2024 general election.

title: EU parliament scraps proposal to halve pesticide use
description: In a 299-to-207 vote, the recommendation was refused, reflecting right-wing parties' desires to win votes from farmers before the EU elections in June.

title: Israel-Hamas war: The five weeks of back-channel talks that led to a truce
description: Fifty women and children held by Hamas in Gaza will be released in exchange for 150 Palestinian prisoners and a limited truce.

title: 'The challenger may have changed, but the world's leading superpower is still on top'
description: In three decades, China has replaced Russia in the rivalry between the United States and the USSR. The mid-November summit between Joe Biden and Xi Jinping showed that American power remains unchallenged, writes Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: Backed by Microsoft, Sam Altman returns as OpenAI CEO
description: The internal drama at the company that created ChatGPT has taken another twist: Sacked on Friday, the co-founder is back and an interim board of directors has been appointed.

title: Why Palestinian prisoners are central to the cease-fire deal
description: The agreement approved by Israel on Wednesday morning plans for the release of 150 Palestinian prisoners in exchange for the release of 50 women and children held hostage by Hamas. A total of 6,700 Palestinians are believed to be imprisoned by Israel, and some prisoners have died since the attack on October 7.

title: The unbearable wait for families of Israeli hostages
description: Hadas Kalderon, mother of two children kidnapped by Hamas on October 7, does not know if they will be among the hostages released under the agreement approved on Wednesday by Benjamin Netanyahu's government.

title: Palestinian ambassador to France Hala Abou Hassira watches her city be 'pulverized' in bombings
description: The Gazan diplomat has lost 60 family members in the Israeli bombings. She has been the Palestinian Authority's representative in France for the past two years.

title: OpenAI says its co-founder Sam Altman to return as CEO, days after being fired
description: Altman was fired by the board  of OpenAI on Friday, and was then hired by Microsoft on Sunday. OpenAI announced that he would return to the company on Tuesday.

title: Scientists finally identify protein responsible for initiating ovarian development in embryo
description: More than thirty years after the discovery of the genetic signal responsible for embryonic masculinization, a French team has pinpointed the subtle mechanism that triggers ovarian growth.

title: The five surprises of the James Webb telescope
description: After a first annual cycle of observations of the Universe's youth, the spectacular images sent back by the space telescope have already upset many astrophysicists' predictions. Everything in the cosmos happened earlier and faster than expected.

title: Israeli Cabinet approves cease-fire with Hamas that includes release of some 50 hostages
description: Israel and Hamas agreed to a four-day truce that would see the Palestinian group release dozens of hostages taken on October 7, both sides announced Wednesday.

title: Basildon, a journey into the heart of the UK's stagnating economy
description: As Rishi Sunak's government presents its budget on Wednesday, November 22, it faces a stagnant economy and an  cost of living crisis.

title: Sweden to impose 'honorable lifestyle' as Residency Condition
description: On Tuesday, the ruling coalition of right-wing and far-right parties announced its intention to expel foreign citizens who fail to respect the kingdom's 'fundamental values.'

title: Netherlands: Geert Wilders, the latest spoiler in a knife-edge general election
description: The far-right leader, who has watered down his anti-Islam program, is buoyed by the latest polls ahead of Wednesday's November 22 vote.

title: More than two months after the earthquake in Morocco: 'We don't know how we're going to get through the winter in these tents'
description: As temperatures continue to fall, not all disaster victims have received the emergency aid promised by the Moroccan government. Many are living in precarious conditions.
